ltex.ignoreRuleInSentence.sentence: ^\QIceCube is also capable of searching for point-like sources icecube_collaboration_time-integrated_2020, and serves in the SuperNova Early Warning System kopke_supernova_2011.\E$
^\QIceCube is also capable of searching for point-like sources icecube_collaboration_time-integrated_2020, and serves in the SuperNova Early Warning System kopke_supernova_2011.\E$
^\QMeasurements of certain neutrino properties may help us understand phenomena such as why the universe is matter-dominated nunokawa_cp_2008 and dark matter baur_dark_2019.\E$

^\QTo date, classical methods, such as PegLeg leuermann_testing_2018 and Retro Reco have mostly been used for this purpose, but the burgeoning proliferation of the use of machine learning (ML) for scientific discovery raghu_survey_2020 inspires the development of new methods for this cause.\E$
^\QThe intention of this thesis is to explore that proposition, specifically for up-going muon neutrinos in the sub-teraelectronvolt range.\E$

^\QThe current best reconstruction algorithm for this case, Retro Reco, can take minutes to reconstruct a neutrino, while an ML-based approach can be expected to reconstruct several thousand each second.\E$
^\QAn additional focus will be the IceCube upgrade ishihara_icecube_2019, which will install additional improved detectors, and for which there is no current functioning reconstruction algorithm.\E$
^\Q./chapters/summary_and_outlook\E$
^\QFor that, we need an understanding of the particle physics and machine learning techniques involved, which is explored in chap:particle_physics,chap:machine_learning, respectively.\E$
^\QFor that, we need an understanding of the particle physics and machine learning techniques involved, which is explored in chap:particle_physics,chap:machine_learning, respectively.\E$
^\Qchap:design goes into the design of the algorithm, including such details as loss functions and optimizers, while chap:results shows results and comparisons to existing methods.\E$
^\QLastly, a summary and outlook is given in chap:summary_and_outlook.\E$

^\QAs chance allows some neutrinos to interact in or around the instrumented ice, new particles are created that in turn send out a specific form of light (sec:cherenkov_radiation) which the photomultiplier tubes can detect.\E$
^\QAt some point an interaction will create such a particle (sec:neutrino_interactions), which oscillates between different flavors (sec:neutrino_oscillations).\E$

^\QThe story of an interaction in IceCube, as told in this thesis, proceeds at a very high level as follows: The universe is created with mechanisms that only allow a certain chirality of neutrinos to interact with forces other than gravity (sec:the_weak_interaction).\E$

^\QAs chance allows some neutrinos to interact in or around the instrumented ice, new particles are created that in turn send out a specific form of light (sec:cherenkov_radiation) which the photomultiplier tubes (sec:doms) can detect.\E$

^\QAs chance allows some neutrinos to interact in or around the instrumented ice, new particles are created that in turn send out a specific form of light (sec:cherenkov_radiation) which the photomultiplier tubes (sec:doms) can detect.\E$
^\Q(sec:current_reconstruction_methods).\E$

^\QThis pipeline also attempts to classify event types, using decision trees, until finally algorithms — none of them machine learning based — reconstruct neutrino properties of interest such as energy and direction (sec:current_reconstruction_methods), and the events at all levels of cleaning are saved in an IceCube proprietary format, called I3 (sec:i3_file_format).\E$

^\QWith the IceCube upgrade this changes (sec:icecube_upgrade), and new optical modules will be fitted with additional photomultiplier tubes which should help with determining the direction of neutrinos.\E$
^\QFirst the basics of machine learning in general (sec:ml_basics), then deep learning in particular (sec:deep_learning).\E$

^\QBecause loss functions are such an important part of any deep learning project, a section is devoted to this concept as well (sec:loss_functions), and for the most part, before data can be meaningfully trained in a neural network, some form of data transformation is required (sec:data_transformation).\E$
^\QThe data format provided by IceCube is not machine learning friendly, so a new solution fixing those shortcomings was built (sec:sqlite).\E$

^\QThe story of an interaction in IceCube from physics to analysis proceeds at a very high level as follows: The universe is created with mechanisms that only allow a certain chirality of neutrinos to interact with forces other than gravity (sec:the_weak_interaction).\E$
^\Q[figwidth=]A Standard Model standard figure, showing leptons, quarks etc.\E$
^\QCherenkov radiation.\E$

^\QThe masses of the neutrinos themselves is a mystery, but sterile neutrinos may also be a dark matter candidate and the possible CP-violating phase in the PMNS matrix may help explain baryon asymmetry.\E$
^\QThe concept of neutrino oscillations has the ability to constrain the previously mentioned CP-violating phase of the neutrino mixing matrixthe_t2k_collaboration_constraint_2020\E$
^\QThe concept of neutrino oscillations has the ability to constrain the previously mentioned CP-violating phase of the neutrino mixing matrixthe_t2k_collaboration_constraint_2020\E$
^\QThe concept of neutrino oscillations has the ability to constrain the previously mentioned CP-violating phase of the neutrino mixing matrix the_t2k_collaboration_constraint_2020\E$

^\QThe concept of neutrino oscillations has the ability to constrain the previously mentioned CP-violating phase of the neutrino mixing matrix the_t2k_collaboration_constraint_2020 and so the better we are able to measure this, the better the constraint will be.\E$
^\QImage from missmj_standard_2019\E$
^\Qeq:dirac_equation_1 came about out of needing to reconcile special relativity and quantum mechanics.\E$

^\QThe Dirac equation leads to the form of the matrix elements in the different possible interactions, for example the electromagnetic scattering of an electron and tau (seen in fig:feynman_e_tau), \E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\Q, where \E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\Q represents the spinor of a particle, \E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\Q the anti-spinor and the momenta \E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\Q correspond to fig:feynman_e_tau.\E$
^\Qeq:dirac_equation_1 came about out of needing to reconcile special relativity and quantum mechanics.\E$
^\Qfeynman_e_tau Feynman diagram showing the \E(?:Dummy|Ina|Jimmy-)[0-9]+\Q-channel scattering of an electron and a tau.\E$
^\Qeq:qed_interaction shows the prominence of the gamma matrices in the fundamental interactions, which is of some importance in the weak interaction, to be discussed in sec:the_weak_interaction.\E$
^\Qeq:qed_interaction shows the prominence of the gamma matrices in the fundamental interactions, which is of some importance in the weak interaction, to be discussed in sec:the_weak_interaction.\E$
